top_categories.workout_context: Kalona Horseshoe's Iowa rolling gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Kalona Horseshoe's Iowa rolling, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Kalona Horseshoe. Train it until it feels boring.
At Kalona Horseshoe, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Kalona Horseshoe's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
50 miles on Iowa rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
When someone attacks on Iowa rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Kalona Horseshoe, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Varied gradients on Iowa rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Base fitness for Kalona Horseshoe. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
2-minute all-out efforts on Iowa rolling gravel. Closing gaps, responding to attacks, sprinting for position. Train the burn.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Kalona Horseshoe’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Kalona Horseshoe requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on iowa rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: iowa rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and G Spot to prepare you for 50 miles of iowa rolling gravel in Kalona, Iowa.
